recommendations: May 19, 2017, Carl worked with Chris but at different companies

Chris is an extraordinary individual.  I've known him professionally for around four years. In that time he has consistently demonstrated an exceptionally keen eye for detail, boundless patience, and a near insatiable obsession for expanding the breadth of his knowledge.  He is a talented developer with key strength in his work with video.  He also raises the bar as an interviewer.  Chris has a very open mind and explores budding technologies for fun.  Talk to him about something novel, and in under a week, he'll be back with several new uses for it and often a prototype of one of them.

When I brought Chris into my organization, I needed someone who would quickly come up to speed on my project, then hit the ground running with making it better.  Chris was just the guy for the job.  He worked largely independently, with very little supervision on my part.  He quickly completed the project that I had brought him in to do, but did such a good job with it, that I kept him around to assist on a much greater scale.  Chris is a "big picture" kind of a guy.  He takes his time getting to it, but once he has embraced a goal, he doesn't take his eyes off it for a minute.  Chris is one who I hope I will someday be able to lure away to join a "dream" QA team, when I get the chance to build it.

May 18, 2011, Chris reported directly to Rob

Rob Perin is a strong hire recommendation for QA and Test manager positions. He builds and leads strong teams that communicate and collaborate well together in fast paced, high visibility, mission critical customer facing product schedules. Rob inspires his employees to work smart and hard. He leads by example, protects and defends his team, and knows how to bring out and hone the strengths of everyone he manages. He is a master of reading a person's character, motives, and requirements, allowing him to interface with a wide range of personalities effortlessly.Rob has exceptional communication skills that set him up for success including 1) Effectively and concisely managing stakeholder expectations 2) Continuously identifying, tracking, and mitigating risks to customers and project deliverables, and 3) Remaining calm, being direct, and communicating effectively when dealing with project emergencies, changing schedules, and hitting moving targets.If I were to enter a war room, and I could only take one other person in with me, it would be Rob Perin I would want at my side.

March 24, 2009, Chris was a client of Aparna’s

I would hire Aparna without hesitation for mid level to high end SDE middle tier and front end Web Application development positions. Her knowledge of Microsoft .NET technologies, C#, ASP.NET, OOP, as well as her HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, and client side UI development skills and experience contributed to the success of the Microsoft Communication and Collaboration Services v1.0 domestic and v1.1 international releases for which I interviewed and hired her for.  I recommend Aparna Mulukutla highly and look forward to the opportunity to work with her again in the future.

summary: Objective  Contribute to the success of a project by applying my skills and experience in areas of software development, quality assurance, team building, and process improvement.  Summary - Facilitated the selection and qualification of technical candidates.- Interviewed over 1,900 engineers for software development, quality assurance, program management, database administration, database architecture and support engineering for mid to senior level positions at Microsoft, Orbitz and Accenture.- Met with over 250 leads and managers of development, test, and program/project management to qualify ~500 technical positions.- Focused on middle tier and front end development of SaaS cloud based top tier high traffic customer facing web properties.- Assembled highly skilled and productive Dev and QA teams.- Wrote standalone, as well as two-tier, and three-tier distributed client/server Winform and Webform applications.- Created applications and tools for the Windows platform beginning January 1995.- Wrote multithreaded Windows GUI applications, console utilities, and Windows services.- Wrote distributed datacenter deployment tools.- Wrote document management systems for online web publishing.Technologies - Used C#, C/C++, Java, .NET 2.0 and .NET 1.1, Win32, MFC, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, T-SQL, Object Oriented Design, Object Oriented Programming, ATL, COM, DCOM, IIS, ADSI, JavaScript, HTML, DHTML, CSS, XML, XSLT, XPath, Regular Expressions, and AJAX technologies.
